messageBody:
russgold wrote:
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Ilja Preuss" <preuss@d...> wrote:
>> J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>>> Ilja Preuï¿½ wrote:
>>>> How would you test that a servlet forwards to the correct JSP
>>>> based on some entry in a database?
>>>
>>> With ServletUnit.
>>
>> That's what I tried. Was quite complicated, if I remember correctly.
>
> I would be very interested to hear of usability problems with
> ServletUnit, so that I can correct them.

Basically, I wanted my servlet to use an object from the ServletContext.
For the test, I wanted to inject a mock implementation, naturally.

The only way I found to make this work was to use the InvocationContext
to access the ServletContext (via Servlet and ServletConfig) and then
call the service method manually (quite similar to the way J.B. uses in
his recipe).

Not what I would call straight forward - I would have prefered to
somehow being able to configure the context via the ServletRunner.

Does that compute?

Cheers, Ilja
